intro: Odontites odontites subsp. vernus, commonly known as the spring toothworts, is a member of the Apiaceae family. It is a small, herbaceous plant characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves and small white flowers. This subspecies is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its flowers are arranged in umbels, a common feature in the carrot family. The plant is known for its rapid growth and ability to thrive in nutrient-rich soils.
